contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The man who bought that house will not have to return it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It is not to be returned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You may buy back those houses, and those who bought them must return them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They may be redeemed, and they must be returned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the houses that the Levites own in their cities" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the houses owned by the Levites in their cities

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Levites may redeem them at any time" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: may be redeemed at any time

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the one who bought the house in the city where it is located must return it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the house that was sold in the city where it is located must be returned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "But the Levites must not sell the fields around their cities" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: But the fields around their cities may not be sold

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must not sell them as slaves" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They will not be sold as slaves

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "after the foreigner buys your fellow Israelite, someone in the Israelite's family may buy him back" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: after your fellow Israelite has been bought, he may be bought back. Someone in his family may redeem him

contextId.occurrenceNote: The verb "figured" can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They must figure the price of his redemption" or "They must figure how much to pay for the foreigner to set the Israelite free" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The price of his redemption must be figured

contextId.occurrenceNote: If the Israelite bought back his freedom, the foreigner would have to hire a servant to do the work that the Israelite would have done but will not. The verbs "paid" and "hired" can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "according to the rate a person would pay to hire a servant" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: in keeping with the rate paid to a hired servant

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The foreigner who bought him as a slave must treat him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He is to be treated

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one treats him badly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he is not treated with harshness

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form, and who he is to be redeemed from can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "If no one redeems him by these means from the one who bought him as a slave" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: If he is not redeemed by these means

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "falling" represents dying, and "the sword" represents either attacking people with a sword or battle in general. Alternate translation: "they will die when you attack them with the sword" or "you will kill them in battle" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they will fall before you by the sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "your enemies will defeat you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be overpowered by your enemies

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You will gather together" or "You will hide" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You will be gathered together

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You will abandon your land, and your enemies will destroy your cities" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Your land will be abandoned, and your cities will be ruined

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The people of Israel will abandon their land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The land will be abandoned by them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. AT "he must present to the priest the person he is giving" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the person being given must be presented to the priest

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "both it and the one he exchanges it for" or the animals can be referred to simply as "both animals" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: both it and the one for which it is exchanged

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he must reduce the estimated value" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the valuation of it must be reduced

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he can no longer buy it back" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it cannot be redeemed any more

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that someone has completely given to Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that has been completely given to Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the man who sold it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the man from whom it was bought

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The priests must determine the estimated values" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: All the valuations must be set

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he must add a fifth to that value" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a fifth must be added to that value

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If the person does not buy back the animal" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: If the animal is not redeemed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the priest must sell it at the set value" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it is to be sold at the set value

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one may sell or redeem anything a man has devoted to Yahweh, from all that he has, whether it is a human, an animal, or his family land" or "If a man devotes to Yahweh anything he has, whether human or animal, or his family land, no one may sell or redeem it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: nothing that a man devotes to Yahweh, from all that he has, whether human or animal, or his family land, may be sold or redeemed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. "No one may pay a ransom" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: No ransom may be paid

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for any person whom Yahweh has devoted to destruction" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for the person who is devoted for destruction

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must put that person to death" or "you must kill that person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: That person must be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must set apart one-tenth to Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: one-tenth must be set apart to Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "He cannot redeem it" or "He cannot buy it back" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It cannot be redeemed
